messages.content:
It's been a privilege to serve as your Member of Parliament where I've led on issues such as clean energy, climate change and fighting for a good standard of housing and education for all in Southampton.

In this election your choice locally will be clearer than ever; a strong voice for Southampton or a Tory who will sit in Parliament to prop up Theresa May's agenda; privatising the NHS, introducing a two tier education system and rewarding the wealthy at the expense of the many.

Re-elect me on Thursday 8 June and I promise to continue speaking up for local people and for Southampton as our strong voice in Parliament.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: We will build 1 million homes in the next 5 years and invest millions more.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: NHS workers, patients and their visitors
keyPolicies.policyDescription: We will make parking at NHS England hospitals free for patients, visitors and NHS staff.
We will build an education system for the many not the few with proper support for schools and keeping class sizes down.
We will protect the triple lock on pensions ensuring that your pension grows each year.
We will introduce the National Living Wage of £10 an hour by 2020.

issues.education: Alan has been fighting Tory cuts to schools. Since 2010 Southampton schools have seen a funding cut equivalent to the loss of 359 teachers. If re-elected I will continue to hold Theresa May and her government to account on this issue and fight for our children's education.
issues.environment: Working to tackle air pollution. Southampton was one of a handful of cities highlighted as having particularly poor air quality and I've been working with the Council, the port, and taxi drivers in the city to tackle this. If re-elected I promise to make sure the air we breathe is clean.
issues.health: We will make parking at NHS England hospitals free for patients, visitors and NHS staff.

community.content: ...and setting up the Southampton Rental Charter. I set up the Southampton Rental Charter to raise housing standards in the private rental sector. If re-elected on Thursday 8 June I will continue working to ensure that everyone has access to safe and decent housing.

contactInformation.address: Unit 39 Basepoint, Andersons Road, Southampton SO14 5FE

endorsements.endorsement: As a parent and an NHS worker I've been impressed with Alan's work on both education and the NHS in Southampton. Recently, I've seen him fighting cuts to both, and he's been a really strong voice for our community. He's a hardworking local MP and is always around to listen to any issues or concerns we have.

examples: Since 2010 Southampton schools have seen a funding cut equivalent to the loss of 359 teachers.
We will introduce the National Living Wage of £10 an hour by 2020.
Alan has been fighting Tory cuts to schools.
We will build an education system for the many not the few with proper support for schools and keeping class sizes down.
We will protect the triple lock on pensions ensuring that your pension grows each year.
I've seen him fighting cuts to both [education and NHS], and he's been a really strong voice for our community.
Alan has been fighting Tory cuts to schools.
...and setting up the Southampton Rental Charter.
Homes for the future: We will build 1 million homes in the next 5 years and invest millions more.
NHS workers, patients and their visitors: We will make parking at NHS England hospitals free for patients, visitors and NHS staff.
Education system: We will build an education system for the many not the few with proper support for schools and keeping class sizes down.
Triple lock on pensions: We will protect the triple lock on pensions ensuring that your pension grows each year.
Living wage: We will introduce the National Living Wage of £10 an hour by 2020.

personalStories.story: Rachael from Portswood's endorsement emphasizing her personal experiences with Alan's work on education and the NHS.

examples: As a parent and an NHS worker I've been impressed with Alan's work on both education and the NHS in Southampton. Recently, I've seen him fighting cuts to both, and he's been a really strong voice for our community. He's a hardworking local MP and is always around to listen to any issues or concerns we have.
Alan has been fighting Tory cuts to schools.
Theresa May's agenda; privatising the NHS, introducing a two-tier education system and rewarding the wealthy at the expense of the many.
